reasoning: Neuropsychiatric manifestations (NPSLE) occur in 14-75% of SLE patients. Using prevalence base of ~30 per 100k SLE patients globally with NPSLE in ~15%, yields ~4.5 per 100k prevalence. Incidence estimate ~0.8 per 100k from subset of new SLE diagnoses developing NPSLE features.
source: Ainiala H et al. (2005). The prevalence of neuropsychiatric syndromes in systemic lupus erythematosus. Neurology. 64(3):359-363
